SourceAnalyzer.Name: Readability Rules
SourceAnalyzer.Description: Rules which ensure that the code is well-formatted and readable.

Rule.Name: DoNotPrefixCallsWithBaseUnlessLocalImplementationExists
Rule.Context: The call to {0} should only use the 'base.' prefix if the item is declared virtual in the base class and an override (or new) is defined in the local class.
Rule.Description: Verifies that the 'base.' prefix is not misused.

Rule.Name: PrefixLocalCallsWithThis
Rule.Context: The call to {0} must begin with the 'this.' prefix to indicate that the item is a member of the class.
Rule.Description: Verifies that calls to local members are prefixed with the 'this.' notation.

Rule.Name: PrefixCallsCorrectly
Rule.Context: The call to {0} must begin with the 'this.', 'base.', 'object.' or '{1}.' prefix to indicate the intended method call.
Rule.Description: Verifies that calls to members are prefixed with the correct notation. In some case from sourcecode analysis we cannot be sure which prefix is required.

Rule.Name: QueryClauseMustFollowPreviousClause
Rule.Context: The query clause must begin on the line after the previous clause, with no blank lines in between.
Rule.Description: Validates that blank lines are not placed between clauses within a query expression.

Rule.Name: QueryClausesMustBeOnSeparateLinesOrAllOnOneLine
Rule.Context: All clauses in the query expression must be placed on the same line, or each clause must begin on a new line.
Rule.Description: Verifies that each clause in a query expression must begin on a new line, unless the entire expression is on a single line.

Rule.Name: QueryClauseMustBeginOnNewLineWhenPreviousClauseSpansMultipleLines
Rule.Context: A query clause must begin on a new line if the previous clause spans multiple lines.
Rule.Description: Verifies that a query clause begins on a new line if the previous clause spans multiple lines.

Rule.Name: QueryClausesSpanningMultipleLinesMustBeginOnOwnLine
Rule.Context: If a query clause spans multiple lines, it must begin on its own line.
Rule.Description: Validates that a query clause spanning multiple lines begins on a new line.

Rule.Name: CodeMustNotContainEmptyStatements
Rule.Context: The code contains an extra semicolon.
Rule.Description: Detects the presense of extra, unnecessary semicolons in the code.

Rule.Name: CodeMustNotContainMultipleStatementsOnOneLine
Rule.Context: A line may only contain a single statement.
Rule.Description: Validates that multiple statements are not placed on a single line of code.

Rule.Name: BlockStatementsMustNotContainEmbeddedComments
Rule.Context: A comment may not be placed within the bracketed statement.
Rule.Description: Validates that there are no comments placed between the declaration and opening bracket in a bracketed statement.

Rule.Name: BlockStatementsMustNotContainEmbeddedRegions
Rule.Context: A region may not be placed within the bracketed statement.
Rule.Description: Validates that there are no regions placed between the declaration and opening bracket in a bracketed statement.

Rule.Name: UseReadableConditions
Rule.Context: Do not use comparison where value goes first, reverse order of operands in '{0}'.
Rule.Description: Validates that value first comparison is not used.

Rule.Name: OpeningParenthesisMustBeOnDeclarationLine
Rule.Context: The opening parenthesis or bracket must be placed on the same line as the name of the {0}.
Rule.Description: Verifies that the opening bracket of a parameter list is placed just after the name of the method, on the same line.

Rule.Name: ClosingParenthesisMustBeOnLineOfLastParameter
Rule.Context: The closing parenthesis or bracket must be placed on the same line as the last parameter in the parameter list.
Rule.Description: Verifies that the closing bracket of a parameter list is placed just after the last parameter, on the same line.

Rule.Name: ClosingParenthesisMustBeOnLineOfOpeningParenthesis
Rule.Context: The closing parenthesis or bracket must be placed on the same line as the opening parenthesis or bracket.
Rule.Description: Verifies that the closing bracket of a parameter list is placed just after the opening bracket when the method has no parameters.

Rule.Name: CommaMustBeOnSameLineAsPreviousParameter
Rule.Context: The comma must be placed on the same line as the previous parameter.
Rule.Description: Verifies that a comma between two parameters is placed just after the previous parameter, on the same line.

Rule.Name: ParameterListMustFollowDeclaration
Rule.Context: The first parameter in the parameter list must be placed on the same line as the opening bracket, parenthesis or on the next line.
Rule.Description: Verifies that the first parameter in a parameter list is placed on the same line as the opening bracket, parenthesis or on the next line.

Rule.Name: ParameterMustFollowComma
Rule.Context: The parameter must begin on the line after the previous parameter.
Rule.Description: Verifies that a parameter is placed on the line after the previous comma, in a multi-line parameter list.

Rule.Name: SplitParametersMustStartOnLineAfterDeclaration
Rule.Context: If the {0} parameters are on separate lines, the first parameter must begin on the line beneath the name of the {0}.
Rule.Description: Verifies that the first parameter in a parameter list is placed on the line beneath the opening bracket, in a multi-line parameter list.

Rule.Name: ParametersMustBeOnSameLineOrSeparateLines
Rule.Context: All {0} parameters must be placed on the same line, or each parameter must be placed on a separate line.
Rule.Description: Verifies that each parameter in a parameter list is placed on its own line, unless all parameters are on the same line.

Rule.Name: ParameterMustNotSpanMultipleLines
Rule.Context: The parameter spans multiple lines. If the parameter is short, place the entire parameter on a single line. Otherwise, save the contents of the parameter in a temporary variable and pass the temporary variable as a parameter.
Rule.Description: Validates that no parameter spans across multiple lines, other than the first parameter in a parameter list.

Rule.Name: CommentsMustContainText
Rule.Context: The comment is empty. Add text to the comment or remove it.
Rule.Description: Validates that a comment contains description text.

Rule.Name: UseBuiltInTypeAlias
Rule.Context: Use the built-in type alias '{0}' rather than {1} or {2}.
Rule.Description: Enforces the use of the built-in types rather than the actual types that they represent.

Rule.Name: UseShorthandForNullableTypes
Rule.Context: Use the shorthand of the nullable type.
Rule.Description: Enforces the use of the shorthand of a nullable type rather than the Nullable<T> except inside a typeof().

Rule.Name: UseStringEmptyForEmptyStrings
Rule.Context: Use string.Empty rather than "".
Rule.Description: Enforces the use of the string.Empty property for empty strings.

Rule.Name: DoNotPlaceRegionsWithinElements
Rule.Context: The use of regions is not allowed within code elements. Remove the #region and #endregion tags.
Rule.Description: Prevents the use of regions within code elements, which limits code readability.

Rule.Name: DoNotUseRegions
Rule.Context: The use of regions is not allowed. Remove the #region and #endregion tags.
Rule.Description: Prevents the use of regions anywhere within the code.
